description: Borrowed from Latin cannabis (“hemp”), from Ancient Greek κάνναβις (kánnabis). See there for more. Doublet of canvas and hemp.

entries.meaning: A tall annual dioecious plant (Cannabis, especially Cannabis sativa), native to central Asia and having alternate, palmately divided leaves and tough bast fibers.
examples: Hyponyms: Cannabis sativa, Cannabis indica, Cannabis ruderalis

entries.meaning: A mildly euphoriant or sedating, intoxicating hallucinogenic drug prepared from various parts of this plant.
examples: Synonyms: 420, bhang, bud, dope, draw, ganja, grass, herb, leaf, marijuana, pot, puff, string, reefer, skunk, THC, weed

entries.meaning: The purified and decarboxylated resin of the cannabis plant used for medicinal purposes rather than for any intoxicating effects.
